title: There are better arguments for raising the voting age than lowering it
text:
Our society – through nanny state policies and paranoid parenting – infantilises young adults.

The spectre of votes for 16 year olds has become a depressing fixture of our politics. No discussion of future elections seems complete without some “progressive” politician carping on about the “disenfranchised young”, or a naked effort to change the rules at the final hour, as the government’s opponents have attempted.

The most popular arguments trotted out for Votes at 16 are tediously familiar: 16 year olds are allowed to join the army, get married, and pay taxes, claim advocates. Why should they be prevented from exercising their democratic rights? But not only would this be a cynical, scrutiny-free...
